basic.floral_language:
Hippeastrum rutilum
Floriography: hot, passionate, loyal
Has beautiful green leaves, scape sprouted from the middle of the leaf blades, one or several huge flowers on the top of scape, exotic and like lilies with beautiful red, orange, pink, or complex color. Commonly used in interior decoration or flower beds.
Hippeastrum likes the sun with tolerance to half shade, blooms in spring or winter, available for viewing in 2-3 weeks. After flowering, cut the scape and leave the bulbs for sprouting in the next year, normally may bloom for years.
basic.blooming: Flowering period in winter and spring, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes sunshine, but avoid strong light, in summer put in places with bright scattered light, in winter full sun
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 10-15 days in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
